title: Strictly's Emma Weymouth accentuates her physique in a ruched red dress at jewellery event
text:
She narrowly avoided the axe from Strictly Come Dancing as she landed a spot in the bottom two against presenter Dev Griffin.

But Emma Weymouth looked cheery as she enjoyed a brief break from rehearsals to attend an Pomellato event in London on Monday evening.

The model, 33, commanded attention as she slipped her sensational physique into a red ruched dress, complete with a trendy square neckline.

Beaming: Emma Weymouth looked cheery as she enjoyed a brief break from Strictly rehearsals to attend an Pomellato event in London on Monday evening

Toning down her vibrant appearance, the socialite added to her height in a pair of nude patent heels.

The Fiorucci ambassador - who is coupled up with pro Aljaž Škorjanec on the BBC One series - was dripping in diamonds as she accessorised her look with a bedazzled gold necklace and a matching bracelet from the luxury Italian fashion fine jeweler.

With her tresses styled into a straight, Emma coordinated her classic lipstick choice with her ensemble, while thick eyeliner and matte foundation completed her make-up look.

On Sunday, TV and radio personality Dev, 34, became the third celebrity to be eliminated from this year's Strictly Come Dancing, following an unexpected dance-off against the Viscountess.

Catching the eye: The model, 33, commanded attention as she slipped her sensational physique into a red ruched dress, complete with a trendy square neckline

Close call: She narrowly avoided the axe from the BBC One competition series as she landed a spot in the bottom two against presenter Dev Griffin (pictured)

Standing tall: Toning down her vibrant appearance, the socialite added to her height in a pair of nude patent heels

The radio host, 34, performed a Cha Cha to Dancing With A Stranger by Sam Smith and Normani with partner Dianne Buswell, 30, in a bid to stay in the competition, but the judges voted unanimously to save chef Emma.

Last month, honey-blonde beauty Emma opened up about her struggles with pregnancy as she revealed the heartbreaking diagnosis that meant she couldn't have anymore children naturally.

In an interview with Grazia magazine, the media personality, whose second child was born via surrogate, discussed her fertility issues as she tearfully admitted that 'I can't talk about it without crying.'

Emma, is married to Ceawlin, Viscount Weymouth, with whom she shares two sons John, four and Henry, two.

All in the details: The Fiorucci ambassador accessorised her look with a bedazzled gold necklace and a matching bracelet from the Italian jeweler (pictured with Amber Le Bon)

Effortlessly chic: Fellow model Amber, 30, stunned in a pale pink blazer, skinny jeans and a white V-neck shirt

In good company: The pair joined Pomellato's managing director Stéphane Gerschel at the event

But while the boys are her world, the Kensington native revealed the journey to motherhood wasn't the easiest for her, with the star facing heartbreaking health problems along the way.

While pregnant with her eldest son John, she was diagnosed with hypophysitis, which causes swelling in the pituitary gland.

The illness meant she was forced to have an emergency C-section and devastatingly, she was later told she couldn't have any more children naturally.

After the couple used a surrogate to welcome son Henry, Emma explained: 'We were lucky to be able to do that. There are so many different ways to make your family. I’m just super-grateful to have my children.’

Girls night out: Socialite Tamara Beckwith Veroni, Pomellato CEO Sabina Belli and businesswoman Warly Tomei were also in attendance
